message.content:
{"id": "18934", 
 "title": "Scrollbars should be disabled in ImageAnalyzer example",
 "description": "When opening the ImageAnalyzer example in Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2 and KDE 2.2 (GTK2 only), the scrollbars are enabled and can be moved around, but they do not have any effect. This is particularly misleading when opening a small image, such as an icon, as the scrollbars do not serve any purpose.",
 "OB": "Scrollbars are enabled in the ImageAnalyzer example.",
 "EB": "Scrollbars should be disabled in the ImageAnalyzer example.",
 "SR": "When opening the ImageAnalyzer example, the scrollbars should be disabled and not allow any movement."}

origin.input_content:

If you open a small image, like an icon, the scrollbars arejust misleading because they don't do anything. "}
